files.description: EHI Export Data Dictionary - 63 pages covering ~97 tables with column definitions, export format specs (CSV/Parquet), and access instructions
FHIR R4 CapabilityStatement - machine-readable server capability declaration listing 32 supported resource types
FHIR service base URL bundle with Endpoint and Organization resources for all Flatiron customers
Flatiron FHIR API Overview - technical documentation covering service base URL, supported profiles, OAuth2, launch mechanisms, operations
FHIR portal home page - getting started guide, developer account setup, registration process
files.curl_command: Browser required (Salesforce SPA). Navigate to https://flatiron.my.site.com/FHIR/s/

files.description: Index of 38 FHIR resource documentation article URLs
FHIR Resources/Profiles topic listing page text
FHIR Patient resource documentation - data elements, search params, US Core STU 6.1.0 profile
FHIR AllergyIntolerance resource documentation with field mappings
FHIR Condition - Encounter Diagnosis resource documentation with field mappings
FHIR API FAQ - supported resources, USCDI data elements, search parameters
API pricing - patient access free; USCDI v1 included for OncoEMR customers; fees for value-added services
Full legal terms and conditions for FHIR API usage
Full HTML source of the ONC certification page
Screenshot of the EHI Export Documentation section on the certification page
Screenshot of the FHIR API documentation portal home page

notes: Flatiron provides comprehensive EHI export documentation. The primary artifact is a 63-page PDF data dictionary covering ~97 database tables exported in CSV (single patient) and Parquet (population) formats. The FHIR API documentation is hosted on a Salesforce Experience Cloud portal requiring browser rendering, but the FHIR REST endpoints (CapabilityStatement, service base URL) are publicly accessible via curl. 38 individual FHIR resource articles exist; 3 representative ones were captured with the full index preserved for reproducibility.
